title: Reflectionless operators and automorphic Herglotz functions
abstract:
I am interested in canonical systems and Dirac operators that are
reflectionless on an open set. In this situation, the half line $m$ functions
are holomorphic continuations of each other and may be combined into a single
function. By passing to the universal cover of its domain, we then obtain a
one-to-one correspondence of these operators with Herglotz functions that are
automorphic with respect to the Fuchsian group of covering transformations. I
investigate the properties of this formalism, with particular emphasis given to
the measures that are automorphic in a corresponding sense. This will shed
light on the reflectionless operators as a topological space, on their extreme
points, and on how the heavily studied smaller space of finite gap operators
sits inside the (much) larger space.
